posts.post_content: Man, there've been some AWESOME clone variants recently; [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph), [Phantasmal image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal image), and now this guy! I'm guessing this guy will take out more than his fair share of opposing titans.

posts.post_content:
Ash: What are you? Are you me?  
Evil Ash: Whad are do? Are do be? HAHAHAHAHAH! You sound like a jerk!  
Ash: Why ya doin' this, huh?  
Evil Ash: Oh, you wanna know? 'Cause the answer's easy! I'm BAD Ash... and you're GOOD Ash! You're a goody little two-shoes! Little goody two-shoes! Little goody two-shoes!  
  
Evil Ash: Goody little TWO-SHOES! Goody little TWO-SHOES! HEHEHEHEHE!  
  
Evil Ash: GOODY LITTLE TWO-SHOES! GOODY LITTLE...  
Ash:   
  
Ash: Good. Bad. I'm the guy with the gun.

Posted By: kittyspit (10/7/2011 8:17:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Gcrudaplaneswalker: It comes in as a 0/0 and is a stillbirth.  
  
This is another one of those shapeshifters where I think it is totally inane, flavor-wise, that the legend rule applies! Why can't a legend have a long-lost evil twin bent on replacing them??  
  
EDIT: A guy at the pre-release used this to copy my [Voiceless Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voiceless Spirit) and then kill it (as it was the only flyer around, it was a good target choice). Therefore, I decided [an exorcism was urgently needed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=227066)! :D  
  
The look on his face was priceless. Even the judge standing next to him was amused.
posts.html:
@Gcrudaplaneswalker: It comes in as a 0/0 and is a stillbirth.

This is another one of those shapeshifters where I think it is totally inane, flavor-wise, that the legend rule applies! Why can't a legend have a long-lost evil twin bent on replacing them??

EDIT: A guy at the pre-release used this to copy my Voiceless Spirit and then kill it (as it was the only flyer around, it was a good target choice). Therefore, I decided an exorcism was urgently needed! :D

The look on his face was priceless. Even the judge standing next to him was amused.

posts.post_content: 4.5/5 for being a more adaptable version of [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone). You can create a copy of a creature you control that you wouldn't mind having another of ([Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus), anyone?) or creating a copy of a creature your opponent controls that's more than an annoyance ("You think your [Carnifex Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnifex Demon) is pretty cool, huh? Well, take THIS!)
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
*William Wilson*  
  
"You have conquered, and I yield, Yet, henceforward art thou also dead-- Dead to the World, to Heaven, and to Hope! In me didst thou exist-- and, in my death, see by this image, which is thine own, how utterly thou hast murdered thyself."  
  
I read a short story by Edgar Allen Poe today that reminded me very much of this card
posts.html:
William Wilson

posts.post_content:
I lost a game in the pre-release because of this card and [snapcaster mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=snapcaster mage). He had copied my activated [angelic overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=angelic overseer), and then played the snapcaster (the only human in his deck) to activate his copy, bringing the game to a standstill, 'til I pulled a kill spell.  
Promptly after casting it, he [cackling counterparted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cackling counterparted )  the snapcaster.   
It was a rather lulzy game, to say the least.
posts.html:
